text:
Hello team.

I am facing a peculiar issue. After creating a child theme for one of my clients, the main theme pages have the same theme-override.css and main.css path as the child theme pages. So if I change field.json in the child, those are also reflected on the live page. We tried to use an absolute path to link the parent theme-override.css and the same for main.css files, but it is not working either. If we delete the child theme, CDN paths will go back to normal on live pages. What possibly am I doing wrong? On the other hand, in another test portal, it's working just fine, Like both child and parent theme pages have the right CDN paths that it has to be.

Does someone have any solution for this?
Does anyone know why when I "Add Section" when editing a page in the CMS, I choose four columns, but get four rows? Wondering if my dnd_area has bad syntax:
have you tried to open that page in the editor again, meaning to go out of the page editor and back in? maybe some form of hickup :slightly_smiling_face:
even if you had multiple dnd_areas, it should only add one section, right?

thanks for the reply, yes I've tried reopening.... there is just one D&D (based on boilerplate)..... when I create with a prebuilt page template, it works, so assuming it's something wrong in my custom template
can you share the template code?

_layout.css is missing which is responsive for the DND sections.

Please add this file to you base.html if you are using the theme. If not add this to your template. Hope it will help.

<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/src/css/objects/_layout.css>
ohhhhh, maybe thats what Im missing
yes, that is probably it, but why was it removed if it is based on the boilerplate <@U03NJCNP799>?
still learning the platform, but that stylesheet did it

Hey all I’ve got serveral themes at the root of my design manager and i’m trying to clean up the folders, is there an easy way to move themes into different folders? it seems to be disabled at the moment. If I do move them through the CLI will it break my themes in any way / pages built with the themes / theme setup
